cheese 0.0.2
  • Get started
  • Reference

Divide a data frame into a list

divide.Rd

Separate a data.frame into a list of any depth by one or more stratification columns whose levels become the names.

divide(
    data,
    ...,
    depth = Inf,
    remove = TRUE,
    drop = TRUE,
    sep = "|"
)

Arguments

data

Any data.frame.
...

Selection of columns to split by. See ?dplyr::select for details.
depth

Depth to split the list to. Defaults to Inf. See details for more information.
remove

Should the stratfication columns be removed? Defaults to TRUE.
drop

Should unused combinations of stratification variables be dropped? Defaults to TRUE.
sep

String to separate values of each stratification variable by. Defaults to "|". Only used when the number of stratification columns exceeds the desired depth.

Details

For the depth, use positive integers to move from the root and negative integers to move from the leaves. The maximum depth will be used for integers larger than such.

Value

A list with tibble::tibble objects at the leaves.

Examples

require(tidyverse)

#1) Unquoted
heart_disease %>%
    divide(
        Sex
    )
#> $Female
#> # A tibble: 97 x 8
#>      Age ChestPain    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInduced…
#>    <dbl> <fct>     <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>           
#>  1    41 Atypical…   130         204 FALSE            172 No              
#>  2    62 Asymptom…   140         268 FALSE            160 No              
#>  3    57 Asymptom…   120         354 FALSE            163 Yes             
#>  4    56 Atypical…   140         294 FALSE            153 No              
#>  5    48 Non-angi…   130         275 FALSE            139 No              
#>  6    58 Typical …   150         283 TRUE             162 No              
#>  7    50 Non-angi…   120         219 FALSE            158 No              
#>  8    58 Non-angi…   120         340 FALSE            172 No              
#>  9    66 Typical …   150         226 FALSE            114 No              
#> 10    69 Typical …   140         239 FALSE            151 No              
#> # … with 87 more rows, and 1 more variable: HeartDisease <fct>
#> 
#> $Male
#> # A tibble: 206 x 8
#>      Age ChestPain    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInduced…
#>    <dbl> <fct>     <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>           
#>  1    63 Typical …   145         233 TRUE             150 No              
#>  2    67 Asymptom…   160         286 FALSE            108 Yes             
#>  3    67 Asymptom…   120         229 FALSE            129 Yes             
#>  4    37 Non-angi…   130         250 FALSE            187 No              
#>  5    56 Atypical…   120         236 FALSE            178 No              
#>  6    63 Asymptom…   130         254 FALSE            147 No              
#>  7    53 Asymptom…   140         203 TRUE             155 Yes             
#>  8    57 Asymptom…   140         192 FALSE            148 No              
#>  9    56 Non-angi…   130         256 TRUE             142 Yes             
#> 10    44 Atypical…   120         263 FALSE            173 No              
#> # … with 196 more rows, and 1 more variable: HeartDisease <fct>
#> 

#2) Using select helpers
heart_disease %>%
    divide(
        matches("^S")
    )
#> $Female
#> # A tibble: 97 x 8
#>      Age ChestPain    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInduced…
#>    <dbl> <fct>     <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>

#3) Reduce the depth
heart_disease %>%
    divide(
        Sex,
        HeartDisease,
        depth = 1
    ) %>%
    length() #Each combinations
#> [1] 4

#4) Keep columns in result
heart_disease %>%
    divide(
        Sex,
        remove = FALSE
    )
#> $Female
#> # A tibble: 97 x 9
#>      Age Sex   ChestPain    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInduced…
#>    <dbl> <fct> <fct>     <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>           
#>  1    41 Fema… Atypical…   130         204 FALSE            172 No              
#>  2    62 Fema… Asymptom…   140         268 FALSE            160 No              
#>  3    57 Fema… Asymptom…   120         354 FALSE            163 Yes             
#>  4    56 Fema… Atypical…   140         294 FALSE            153 No              
#>  5    48 Fema… Non-angi…   130         275 FALSE            139 No              
#>  6    58 Fema… Typical …   150         283 TRUE             162 No              
#>  7    50 Fema… Non-angi…   120         219 FALSE            158 No              
#>  8    58 Fema… Non-angi…   120         340 FALSE            172 No              
#>  9    66 Fema… Typical …   150         226 FALSE            114 No              
#> 10    69 Fema… Typical …   140         239 FALSE            151 No              
#> # … with 87 more rows, and 1 more variable: HeartDisease <fct>
#> 
#> $Male
#> # A tibble: 206 x 9
#>      Age Sex   ChestPain    BP Cholesterol BloodSugar MaximumHR ExerciseInduced…
#>    <dbl> <fct> <fct>     <dbl>       <dbl> <lgl>          <dbl> <fct>           
#>  1    63 Male  Typical …   145         233 TRUE             150 No              
#>  2    67 Male  Asymptom…   160         286 FALSE            108 Yes             
#>  3    67 Male  Asymptom…   120         229 FALSE            129 Yes             
#>  4    37 Male  Non-angi…   130         250 FALSE            187 No              
#>  5    56 Male  Atypical…   120         236 FALSE            178 No              
#>  6    63 Male  Asymptom…   130         254 FALSE            147 No              
#>  7    53 Male  Asymptom…   140         203 TRUE             155 Yes             
#>  8    57 Male  Asymptom…   140         192 FALSE            148 No              
#>  9    56 Male  Non-angi…   130         256 TRUE             142 Yes

#5) Move from leaves
heart_disease %>%
    divide(
        Sex,
        HeartDisease,
        ChestPain,
        depth = -1
    ) %>%
    str()
#> List of 2
